pet.name: Ginny
pet.description:
Located in Ames, Iowa
If you are interested in adopting, please go to our website at www.castawaypetrescue.org and fill out an adoption application. An adoption counselor will contact you. Please bring any dogs, children, and decision makers to your appointment. Be prepared to adopt and take your new family member home that day if we have a match.
Please note that adoption counselors will only know of your interest if you submit an application. They do not see emails sent to the administration email account. The adoption counselor can answer your questions when they call after receiving your application. Please remember we are an all volunteer organization.
Minimum Adoption Donation is $400 (includes deworming, microchip with free registration, age appropriate vaccinations, spay if performed by our vet, 30 days of health insurance). Any donation above the minimum is appreciated
To give them time to grow, we do not spay/neuter young puppies prior to adoption. However, it is required by law for all dogs adopted from IL rescues and shelters to be altered within 30 days of adoption. We must have proof that it is performed in the 30 days. Adopters may use their own vet at their own cost as long as proof of the surgery is provided in 30 days.
If adopting a puppy and you have adult dogs who go to public places, such as dog parks, they can be tracking home virus' to your puppy. Not only should the puppy be kept home from dog parks, pet stores, and such until he/she completes the puppy vaccination series at 4 months of age, but so should the adult dogs in the household. Please do not adopt a puppy if you cannot protect him/her from exposure to virus' as his/her immune system develops.
Please remember that puppies require a midday meal, frequent potty breaks, and plenty of playtime for the first several months. Make arrangements if needed to have someone visit midday, every day, if no one will be home.
Foster Home Location: Ames, Iowa
Our organization uses 24PetWatch microchips, which include free registration into the 24PetWatch pet recovery service. For more information visit www.24petwatch.com or call 1-866-597-2424.
To help reduce the financial and health risk, this dog also comes with 30 days of pre-paid pet health insurance. For more information please visit www.sheltercare.com or call 1-866-375-PETS.

pet.name: ABBEY
pet.description: Abbey is a 1-2 year old lab/pittie mix. She is very sweet and loving and happy to be around people. She has a high amount of energy, so she would do best with having access to a fenced in back yard for daily romps. She pulls on a leash but with some basic training, this could easily be resolved. She is food motivated. She knows the sit command. She is afraid of cats in a shelter atomosphere. We recommend ages 8 and up for her.

pet.name: Diamond
pet.description:
Diamond is a sweet loving girl who is good with kids and other dogs.
Visit http://www.gsdri.org/dog.php?dogID=286
Visit www.gsdri.org to fill out an application and learn more about our adoption process. Our dogs are all fostered in volunteer homes. Meets and greets are only available by appointment after the application has been processed.
All of our dogs are adopted as indoor house pets. No permanent outside runs or tie outs are allowed.
Adoption fees: $250.00
*BREED DISCLOSURE: Due to the fact that most of our adoptable dogs come from shelters, we can not guarantee their breed. We list the dog's breed as the one that best matches the physical appearance, temperament, and personality of the dog - in some cases it's purely a guess.

pet.name: Diesel
pet.description: All of our dogs are either spayed or neutered. They have been given a distemper and bordetella vaccination, flea treatment, and have been wormed. Since our adoption fee is so low ($35) why not consider a tax free donation. Your support is a key ingredient in the continued success of our shelter. An application must be completed and approved if you would like to adopt a dog from the Story County Animal Shelter. The staff here at the shelter works very hard to find just the right home for each animal that comes through the door. For more information please call us at 515-382-3338.

pet.name: Emma
pet.description: very sweet dog. Will take a few visits to trust a male. Once she trusts you she will make a great companion.

pet.name: Dory
pet.description: Can be snippy around new people. May need adjustment period.

pet.name: Team Speedy and Jason Baconmaker
pet.description:
These two brothers need adopted out as a pair! They are a lovable duo who really need to stay together. They are inseparable, good natured boys, who do extremely well together. They kennel well side by side, eat side by side and want attention side by side. They tested too interested in kitties, so they need a home with out kitties.
Please open your heart to these two!
If you would like to meet this dog, please e-mail HGA at adopt@heartlandgreyhoundadoption.org or call 515-967-6564 (please leave a message) and we will get back to you as soon as possible with more information.The adoption fee for greyhounds through HGA is $275. This fee pays for medical costs including spay/neuter surgery, shots, parasite treatments, and teeth cleaning. HGA also microchips every greyhound prior to adoption as a permanent form of ID. The additional cost for this service is $17.99 ($10.99 if you register at the time of adoption through the Petfinder website or phone number) which covers the chip, activation, and membership and is a substantial savings over the usual cost for microchipping. Each dog also comes with a special sighthound collar and leash set and muzzle. There is a $25 non-refundable application fee that is applied to an approved adoption

pet.name: BGR Chewbacca
pet.description: Meet Chewbacca, he is learning the live after retirement. He is doing well in a home with cats and another greyhound. He is doing stairs and loves car rides! If you would like to meet this dog, please e-mail HGA at wasserbuffel@gmail.com or call 515-967-6564 (please leave a message) and we will get back to you as soon as possible with more information. The adoption fee for greyhounds through HGA is $275. This fee pays for medical costs including spay/neuter surgery, shots, parasite treatments, and teeth cleaning. HGA also microchips every greyhound prior to adoption as a permanent form of ID. The additional cost for this service is $10.99 which covers the chip, activation, and membership and is a substantial savings over the usual cost for microchipping. Each dog also comes with a special sighthound collar and leash set and muzzle. There is a $25 non-refundable application fee that is applied to an approved adoption.

pet.name: Black Ice
pet.description: Black Ice is a young male who has a gorgeous brindle coat. He just loves to lay around healing his front leg which had surgery a few weeks ago. He is not ready to be adopted yet, but will be in a few weeks. He has such a calm personality who just loves rubs and cuddles. If you would like to meet this dog, please e-mail HGA at wasserbuffel@gmail.com or call 515-967-6564 (please leave a message) and we will get back to you as soon as possible with more information. The adoption fee for greyhounds through HGA is $275. This fee pays for medical costs including spay/neuter surgery, shots, parasite treatments, and teeth cleaning. HGA also microchips every greyhound prior to adoption as a permanent form of ID. The additional cost for this service is $10.99 which covers the chip, activation, and membership and is a substantial savings over the usual cost for microchipping. Each dog also comes with a special sighthound collar and leash set and muzzle. There is a $25 non-refundable application fee that is applied to an approved adoption.

pet.description: If you would like to meet this dog, please e-mail HGA at adopt@heartlandgreyhoundadoption.org or call 515-967-6564 (please leave a message) and we will get back to you as soon as possible with more information. The adoption fee for senior greyhounds age 7 and older through HGA is $200. This fee pays for medical costs including spay/neuter surgery, shots, parasite treatments, and teeth cleaning. HGA also microchips every greyhound prior to adoption as a permanent form of ID. The additional cost for this service is $10.99 which covers the chip, activation, and membership and is a substantial savings over the usual cost for microchipping. pet.name: BGR C Three P O
pet.description: Winter weather updates for meet & greets and other events: In case of inclement winter weather, check the Heartland Greyhound Adoption Facebook page for last-minute updates. Or follow us on Facebook and have those updates delivered to your newsfeed! If you would like to meet this dog, please e-mail HGA at adopt@heartlandgreyhoundadoption.org or call 515-967-6564 (please leave a message) and we will get back to you as soon as possible with more information. pet.name: Athena
pet.description:
Athena is approximately 10mo-yr female, friendly Australian Sheppard/Husky mix who was living outside. Being she was living outside, she is currently working on potty training. She is very smart and strong and is high enery so will need daily exercise. She gets along with other dogs, but we don't recommend a home with cats.
If you would like to meet Athena, please complete an online application at https://hopeanimalrescueofiowa.duplie.com/forms/196/dog-application

pet.name: Lucy
pet.description: Lucy is a sweet 1.5 year old girl. She does well with other dogs and kids. Lucy was previously adopted in 2018; however, has returned to rescue due to allergies in the family. If you are interested in meeting Lucy, please apply at hopeanimalrescueofiowa.org.

pet.name: Harper
pet.description:
Harper is a Coon Hound/Boxer mix approximately 1-2 yrs of age. If you are looking for a loyal best friend, you found her!! She will be VERY loyal to her owner an loves to lay on or beside you. She is a cuddler and will want to lay in your bed. She does well with cats and dogs that are her size or smaller (she does not do well with larger dogs) and loves playing with her foster fur siblings. She graduated from Bark Avenue 10 day basic training boot camp, so she has basic commands. We are working on getting some weight on her as she was found as a stray and very thin and abused, so it is amazing she is so loyal and sweet. She does well in a car. Children 10+ would be recommended for Harper and homes without smaller critters (birds, hamsters, guinea pigs, etc.).
If you would like to meet Harper, please complete an online application at http://hopeanimalrescueofiowa.org/forms/196/dog-application

pet.name: Kona
pet.description: Kona is a male Golden Retriever approximately 3 years old. If you would like to meet Kona, please complete an online application at https://hopeanimalrescueofiowa.duplie.com/forms/196/dog-application

pet.name: Keafton
pet.description:
Meet this handsome boy, Keafton! He is a 9 month old beagle/lab mix and I wouldn’t be surprised if there wasn’t a smidge gazelle, with the way he hops and leaps through the air when he playing with our pups. He loves snuggles, our dogs and playing. He is timid around our cats but his foster mom feels he just needs more exposure with them. We are working on socializing him and basic commands. He is timid in new situations and with new people but quickly adjusts. His foster mom believes his confidence will continue to grow through socialization and patience. He is crate trained and is house trained. But he is still a pup so continued reinforcement would be best. He is very eager to please and very smart. We love this beautiful soul who will make someone a special and lovable side kick??. If you would like to meet him contact Hope Animal Rescue of Iowa.
If you would like to meet, please complete an online application at http://hopeanimalrescueofiowa.org/forms/196/dog-application
